Source code for timefraym.calc

#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
Created on Wed Sep 11 10:31:39 2019

@author: mmann
"""


import numpy as np
import os
import pandas as pd
import xarray as xr
import rasterio
from pathlib import Path
from dateparser.search import search_dates
from datetime import timedelta



[docs]def calc_period_metrics(xarray_obj,
                        variable = "NDVI",
                        TF_parameters=None, 
                        example_tif_path = None, 
                        write_tifs = True, 
                        dest_folder = 'Country_Name',
                        root_dir=os.path.join( str(Path.home()),'Documents','TimeFraymStats')):

        '''
        Uses an xarray object to calculate time series statistics at a desired time
        interval. This includes yearly, quarterly, and monthly. Available statistics
        include min max std mean but can be expanded to include numpy static
        functions shown in link below:

        All statistics are numpy statics
        See: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/reference/routines.statistics.html

        :param xarray_obj: An xarray objected created by dir_to_xarray()
        :type xarray_obj: xarray 

        :param variable: String representing the variable of interest for instance 'NDVI' or 'EVI'
        :type variable: character 

        :param TF_parameters: dictionary mapping from time period to feature names, where feature names are numpy static
               routines. Only those names  which are keys in this dict will be calculated 
               - so whenever you delete a key from this dict, you disable the calculation of this feature.
               For year month combinations use the key year_month same for year_quarter
        :type TF_parameters: dictionary 
       
        :param example_tif_path: Path to an example raster file with same properties of extected output
        :type example_tif_path: character 

        :param write_tifs: boolean Should statistics be written to tiffs 
        :type write_tifs: boolean 

        :param dest_folder: All files are written to this folder in the home/Documents/TimeFraymStats/dest_folder
                typically a country name will be used
        :type dest_folder: character 
        
        :param root_dir: character All files are written to this folder  
        :type root_dir: character
        
        :return: multiple xarray object for each time period of interest, based on order of TF_parameters
        
        '''

        # set default metrics 
        
        TF_parameters_default =   { "year": ['max','min','std','mean'],
                                    "year_quarter": ['max','min','std','mean'],
                                    "year_month": ['max','min','std','mean'],
                                    "year_week": ['max','min','std','mean']

                                  } 
        if TF_parameters is None:
            print('Using default parameters')
            TF_parameters=TF_parameters_default 


        # create indexes for year_month and year_quarter (multiple observations per quarter etc)
        year_week = [str(x) +'_'+ str(y) for x, y in zip(xarray_obj.time.dt.year.to_index(), 
                                                                xarray_obj.time.dt.week.to_index()) ]

        year_month = [str(x) +'_'+ str(y) for x, y in zip(xarray_obj.time.dt.year.to_index(), 
                                                                xarray_obj.time.dt.month.to_index()) ]

        year_quarter = [str(x) +'_'+ str(y) for x, y in zip(xarray_obj.time.dt.year.to_index(), 
                                                                xarray_obj.time.dt.quarter.to_index()) ]


        # assign new dimension to groupby
        year = xarray_obj.time.dt.year
        xarray_obj = xarray_obj.assign_coords(year_week    = pd.Index(year_week,   name='time'))
        xarray_obj = xarray_obj.assign_coords(year_quarter = pd.Index(year_quarter,name='time'))
        xarray_obj = xarray_obj.assign_coords(year_month   = pd.Index(year_month,  name='time'))
        xarray_obj = xarray_obj.assign_coords(year         = pd.Index(year,        name='time'))


        # create dictionary with TF_parameter keys initialize with empty list
        periods = {k:{} for k in list(TF_parameters.keys())} 


        # create metrics 
        for key, value in TF_parameters.items():

            for metric in value:
                print('Processing: '+ str(key) + '----'+str(metric))
                
                # generate statistics by period
                summary_stat = xarray_obj.groupby(key).apply(
                                                getattr(xr.DataArray, metric),dim='time')
                
                # update values in dictionary 
                periods[key].update({metric:summary_stat[variable]})


        # create desination folder if writing tifs 
        if write_tifs == True:
            folder = os.path.join(root_dir,dest_folder,*list(xarray_obj.attrs.values()))
            #print('Writing files to ', folder)
            if not os.path.exists(folder):
                os.makedirs(folder)

            # make folders for time keys and write out tifs 
            for key, value in TF_parameters.items():    
                key_folder = os.path.join(folder,key)
                if not os.path.exists(key_folder):
                    os.makedirs(key_folder)
 
                # write out data 
                print('writing to '+ str(key_folder))
                print('key:'+str(key) +'    value' + str(value))
                for metric in periods[key]:
                    for image_period in periods[key][metric]:
                        period_name = image_period[key].values
                        out_name = str(variable) +'_'+ str(metric) +'_'+ str(period_name) + '.tif'                       
                        
                        # write tifs to key_folder 
                        with rasterio.open(example_tif_path) as src:
                            kwds = src.profile
                            kwds.update({
                                'dtype':'float32',
                                'nodata':-9999
                                })
                                       
                            with rasterio.open(os.path.join(key_folder,out_name),'w', **kwds) as dst:
                                dst.write_band(1,np.float32(image_period.values))


        return(periods)

    
 



[docs]def parse_filename_dates(filenames):

    """
    Parses dates from file names
    
    :param filenames: A list of files to parse
    :type filenames: list 
        
    """
    
    date_filenames = list()
    
    for fn in filenames:
    
        d_name, f_name = os.path.split(fn)
        f_base, f_ext = os.path.splitext(f_name)
    
        try:
            s, dt = list(zip(*search_dates(' '.join(' '.join(f_base.split('_')).split('-')),
                                           settings={'DATE_ORDER': 'YMD',
                                                     'STRICT_PARSING': False,
                                                     'PREFER_LANGUAGE_DATE_ORDER': False})))
        except:
            return list(range(1, len(filenames) + 1))
    
        if not dt:
            return list(range(1, len(filenames) + 1))
    
        date_filenames.append(dt[0])
    
    return date_filenames




[docs]def parse_metric_dates(metric_df):
    '''
    Adds datetime column for image metric values extracted by point 
    
    :param metric_df: dataframe containing extracted metric values created
                        by extract_dt_raster_dt_point. 
    :type metric_df:  pandas dataframe    
    
    :return: pandas dataframe with datetime object column for images  
    
    '''
    

    assert (isinstance(metric_df, pd.DataFrame)), "Input must be a dataframe"
     
    if metric_df.index.name == 'year':
        # set to first day of year
        metric_df["metric_date"] = pd.to_datetime(metric_df.metric_date.astype(str),
                                                   format='%Y') 
    if metric_df.index.name == 'year_quarter':
        quarter_to_month = {'1':'01', '2':'04','3':'07','4':'10' }
        
        # breal out image dates to convert 
        dater = pd.DataFrame([])
        dater[['metric_year','metric_period']] = metric_df.metric_date.str.split("_",expand=True)

        # set to first day of month of quarter
        metric_df["metric_date"] = pd.to_datetime(dater.metric_year.astype(str)+
                                                  dater.metric_period.map(quarter_to_month).astype(str),
                                                  format='%Y%m')      
    
    if metric_df.index.name == 'year_month':
        # set to first day of month
        metric_df["metric_date"] = pd.to_datetime(metric_df.metric_date.astype(str),
                                                   format='%Y_%m')       
    
    if metric_df.index.name == 'year_week':
        # set to monday of week
        metric_df["metric_date"] = pd.to_datetime(metric_df.metric_date.astype(str)+'_1',
                                                  format='%Y_%W_%w')       

    return  metric_df





[docs]def get_nearest(datetime_column, date_2_match):
    '''
    finds the nearest date in datetime_column to date_2_match
    
    :param datetime_column:  column of pandas dataframe containing dates to be matched
    :type datetime_column: character
    
    :param date_2_match:  datetime object to search for closest match
    :type date_2_match: datetime
           
    :return: datetime object of the nearest match  
    
    '''
    return min(datetime_column, key=lambda x: abs(x - date_2_match))


 


[docs]def get_nearest_past(datetime_column, date_2_match):
    '''
    finds the nearest preceeding date in datetime_column to date_2_match
    
    :param datetime_column:  column of pandas dataframe containing dates to be matched
    :type datetime_column: character
    :param date_2_match:  datetime object to search for closest match
    :type date_2_match: datetime

           
    :return: datetime object of the nearest match  
    

    '''

    return min(datetime_column, key=lambda x: abs(x - date_2_match) 
                                       if (x - date_2_match) <= timedelta(0) 
                                       else  abs(x - date_2_match)+timedelta(365)) 



[docs]def get_nearest_past_group(df, 
                           group=['id','point_date'], 
                           datetime_column='metric_date', 
                           date_2_match_column='point_date'):
    
    '''
    Applies get_nearest_past to find the nearest preceeding date in datetime_column to date_2_match_column
    
    :param df: dataframe containing remotely sensed data extracted by points
    :type df: pandas dataframe
    
    :param group:  list containing names of columns to group by, typically done by point id
    :type group: list
    
    :param datetime_column:  column of pandas dataframe containing dates to be matched
    :type datetime_column: character
    
    :param date_2_match:  datetime object to search for closest match
    :type date_2_match: datetime

           
    :return: rows of df that most closely preceed date_2_match  
    
    '''
    
    return df.groupby(group).apply(
                    lambda g: g[g[datetime_column]==get_nearest_past(g[datetime_column],g[date_2_match_column][0])] )






[docs]def extract_dt_raster_dt_point(stats_dict, period, metric, 
                               dt_points, lat='y', lon='x', event_date='event_date'):
    '''
    Uses date-time locations (points) to extract metrics of interest from raster files
    for the appropriate date and location. Keeps closest preceeding raster value
    to the point event date.

    For instance, a point file containing the location and time of crop losses can be 
    linkned to rasters of minimum precipitation for the time period of the crop loss event. 

    :param stats_dict: contains extracted metric values created
                        by calc_period_metrics. 
    :type stats_dict: dictionary

    :param period: string indicating the time period from `stats` to be used.
                    Can take values 'year', 'year_quarter', 'year_month', 'year_week'
    :type period: character

    :param metric: string indicating the metric to be used. 
                    Can take values 'max','min','std','mean'
    :type metric: character

    :param dt_points: dataframe containing x,y and datetime columns. Location and 
                    dates used for extracting raster metric data e.g. mean rainfall
    :type dt_points: pandas dataframe

    :param lat: string indicating column name of latitude, assuming same projection as 
                stats_dict input rasters
    :type lat: character

    :param lon: string indicating column name of longitude, assuming same projection as 
                stats_dict input rasters
    :type lon: character

    :param event_date: string indicating name of column containing datetime objects
                holding the date of the point event
    :type event_date: character

    :return: pandas dataframe with date-time points and extracted raster metrics for that 
                    time period of interest
                    
    '''

    # get relevant raster stack & point date time data
    try:
        raster_data = stats_dict[period][metric]

    except KeyError as error:
        print(error)
        print("stats_dict key error please check period and metric")

    try:
        y=dt_points[lat]
        x=dt_points[lon]
        row_name = dt_points.index.values
        date = dt_points['event_date'] 
        
    except:
        print('check column names in dt_points')

    # create empty dataframe to hold outputs
    Newdf = pd.DataFrame([])



    #extract points from rasters
    for i,j,ids,date in zip(y,x,row_name,date):
        dsloc = raster_data.sel(y=i,x=j,method='nearest') 
        DT = dsloc.to_dataframe()

        # insert the name with your preferred column title:
        DT.insert(loc=0,column="point_id",value=ids)
        DT.insert(loc=0,column="point_date",value=date)

        Newdf = Newdf.append(DT,sort=True)

    Newdf['metric_date'] = Newdf.index

    # indicator_metric name
    name = Newdf.columns[0] + '_' + metric
    Newdf.rename(columns={Newdf.columns[0]: name}, inplace=True) 
    
    # add datetime column
    Newdf = parse_metric_dates(Newdf)

    # calc difference between point and metric date
    Newdf['timedelta'] = ( Newdf['point_date'] - Newdf['metric_date'] )/ np.timedelta64(24, 'h')

    # keep metrics preceeding point date
    Newdf = Newdf[Newdf.timedelta >= 0]
    
    # for each point keep minimum timedelta
    Newdf = Newdf.loc[Newdf.groupby('point_id')['timedelta'].idxmin()]
    
    Newdf.drop('timedelta',axis=1, inplace=True)
    
    return Newdf
